summary:
Business, Finance, Creativity

My career has led me to specialize increasingly in the combined management of finance, human resources and business development. I am a generalist, with a CFO role as key area (T profile). My background is a master degree (drs.) in business administration at Erasmus University Rotterdam; I majored in Information Technology management. Until today e-commerce plays a significant role in my professional career.

I have experience in the manufacturing industry, service sector and platform economy, working both on the agency-side as on client-side, B2B, B2G and B2C. Change management <financial reorganization & insourcing>, leading transitions <creating a client focused agile culture> and business development <fire starting new relations> are my expertise. I like working with people; both colleagues and clients.
		
Key words:
Strong analytic thinker, entrepreneur, reliable, fast, negotiator, visionary and down to earth.

Skills:
✅ Familiarity with managing significant budgets (XX M Euro) and people (+200 FTE)
✅ Tested management techniques on C-level
✅ Proven leadership and human management skills
✅ Budget design, forecasting and monitoring
✅ Time-efficient, systematic (agile) working methodology
✅ Rapid adaptability to new problem-solving
✅ Insourcing/Outsourcing (Marketing inhousing, Client Services, Cloud Migrations)
✅ ERP implementations/experience: Afas Profit/Insite, Exact, eSynergy, Timewax, SAP ECC, Picqer (WMS), Freshdesk (Helpdesk software)

I love traveling, marketing, other cultures, running (10K), snowboarding, psychology, (live) music, my wife and three teenagers. Just as my father (writer, painter and former banker at ING) I’m both creative and analytical. My biggest hero is my son Lars who survived cancer (leukaemia). projects.title: Construction of 10,000 m2 photo / film studio facilities and office spaces
projects.description:
In 2006 I was given the opportunity to be project manager of developing 10,000 square meters of photo / film studio's, and office facilities. What a huge project, and completely new for me! I was chairman of a committee of architects (Van Bokhorst Architecten), constructors (Boers Veenendaal), engineers (Snetselaar Constructieve Ingenieurs), technicians (Techtron and ITN), and a lot of other (sub) suppliers. It was really a cool project with some difficulties like the new main reception. We had to take out some square meters of concrete from the lowest part of the existing building, consisting of four floors…. It was really a pleasure working with Rik van Beek from Boers Veenendaal. What a phenomenal guy he is. What a work ethics. It was a difficult period for me that time. I was combining my ‘normal’ work, with this project and my son was suffering leukaemia. I must say Rik was really a moral support for me, besides his great expertise of constructing.

A few years later we hosted the first <worldwide> live shows ever of The Voice of Holland in the new studio. Because I new all the bits and pieces I was contact person for Talpa (production company) regarding all studio facilities, traffic support, emergency plans etcetera. Really a nice project - with maximum four million live viewers on broadcasting television! Rik van Beek was also involved again with his new company Estivo. He arranged a permanent new cooling system for the studio based upon the air from outside. It worked more than perfect!

projects.title: Activity-based costing (ABC) model & software selection (Finance)
projects.description:
When I started at Lukkien there was no project administration - where a lot of projects were running for clients such as Philips, Unilever and many others. I started with a simple PHP application to generate project numbers based upon year, month and serial number. In the PHP application we connected the number with a client name and a project name. Only the project managers could generate a project number, and the finance employees who made the invoices were the only ones who could finish (or close) it. A very simple system but it is still the basis of today’s way of working.

The number is the basis <key> for hours planned, hours made <indirect costs were allocated based upon FTE per business unit>, purchases, invoices, courier drives, work in progress overviews etcetera. In the years that followed we first selected and implemented eSynergy from Exact Business Software (and phased out the PHP application), and later on we implemented also Timewax <planning software>. Timewax had a much better graphical overview regarding overall planning, and the user interface was much more friendly than the UI from Exact Software. I really can recommend Timewax as a product. Also the people behind the software are really client oriented. As an organization you can give feedback that in a lot of cases will be incorporated in future software releases. 

The improvement of financial insights was huge and the following ten years the profitability grew significantly.

projects.title: From a scorecard system to open conversations (HR)
projects.description:
For more than ten years I held evaluation meetings with 200+ employees at Lukkien. A direct manager was always involved in the meetings. So in most cases three people were around the table. In the beginning it took a lot of time for me to set up a scorecard system based upon functions, KPI’s (key performance indicators), years of experience, salary, etcetera. But after a couple of months I completed it and covered all the disciplines involved. Either when we held the meetings based upon the scorecards we experienced a lot of discussions about the exact scores (what is the performance difference between a score of 7 and 8?) and we experienced also that the interviews were a little bit staccato. We scored KPI’s 1 to 10 and that was in a lot of cases more or less immediately the end of the interview. We used the scorecards one year and started later on with open interviews. No list of fixed KPI’s, but open questions. How are you feeling? Are you happy with your projects? How are your team members? Etcetera. 

Our experience was that we got much more feedback from the employees. The atmosphere of the interviews was also much better than before. And of course when we as a management team had some feedback, we had enough opportunities to discuss this. I believe in systems, but based on this experience also very much in open discussions, with arguments. In the years that followed I believed also more and more in the People First methodology. People make or break a company. People are the enablers of innovation as Accenture published in their Technology Vision report.

projects.title: Marketing Inhousing
projects.description:
During 2017 the marketing activities of Royal Dutch Mint were executed by a significant number of external agencies:

-Today is Canday (Advertising agency)
-Progress (PR agency)
-Enof Creatieve Communicatie (Graphic Design agency)
-De Nieuwe Zaak (Online Marketing Agency)
-Eurocase (Logistics and Client Services)

By the end of 2017 we started hiring our own graphic designers, copywriters, online marketeers (email, Ads and Social Media) and customer service operators. We created our own internal agency and closed the feedback-loop by adding client services to our stand-up meetings. In an Agile way we create storytelling projects and “use” the coins as a means of communication just like the Roman emperors started centuries ago. We create campaigns with from time to time new channels and produce our own content. Results? Significant cost-savings, shorter time to market of products and a continuous growth of e-commerce clients and turn-over.

projects.title: Cloud Migrations (IT)
projects.description: At Royal Dutch Mint all file servers were on premises in Utrecht (server room), computers equipped with stand-alone software and the SAP ERP system was not secured for incidents. During 2018 we migrated the whole IT landscape in three steps to the cloud together with our IT-partner Hupra. First all workplaces were migrated to the cloud in order to improve security (Citrix) and management (rollouts, upgrades, user management), secondly we dismantled the server room and virtualized the servers and thirdly we moved the SAP backbone to two virtual servers, loadbalanced and with a back-up strategy. As a result: a state of the art IT landscape, ready for the move to the completely new “The Dutch Vault” building in Houten. I can wholeheartedly recommend IT-partner Hupra since this is the second successfull Cloud migration during my career with them.

profile_positions.title: Mint Master

profile_positions.description:
The Royal Dutch Mint is an independent company working for B2B and B2C clients both national and international, and for central banks across the globe. The Dutch Mint became independent in 1994 and has been allowed to bear the ‘Royal’ predicate since 1999. The Royal Dutch Mint has been privatised since the end of 2016 - sold to Belgian industrial holding Heylen Group. The Royal Dutch Mint runs its operations flexibly, independently and in a market-oriented way.

I joined the Royal Dutch Mint as Chief Financial Officer, with responsibility for the finance, control and HR departments. After a significant and succesfull financial reorganization I was asked to lead also the marketing and sales operation of the B2C e-commerce department, including customer services and IT. I'm very proud of the teams I lead today, the clients we work with and the transition we made together from a formerly owned company by the Dutch government with significant losses to a profitable and agile company with great appealing projects for a broad audience. We went from product focus to storytelling. A result of a significant insourcing operation of (Online) Marketing, PR, Graphic Design, E-commerce fulfillment/logistics and Client Services together with a consistent campaign strategy and great license agreements.

profile_positions.description:
ShoppingTomorrow started in 2013 under the name Shopping2020. Since that time, there have been around twenty expert groups each year that deal with trends and developments within the e-commerce sector.

ShoppingTomorrow is an exclusive and active network that brings together e-commerce professionals and provides insights for the industry. Together, we explore and investigate the retail market and contribute to the transformation of B2B and B2C retail. What do future developments in the field of business models, customer journey and technology, among other things, mean for employees and businesses? The research platform was initiated by Thuiswinkel.org in 2013 and is now supported by over twenty Dutch industry and interest groups.

I was asked to join ShoppingTomorrow based upon my experience at shipping platform KeenDelivery and my background in e-commerce since my master at Erasmus University Rotterdam.

I was part of the rebranding team, and responsible for the marketing & sales department (besides finance, HR, customer services and IT development <inhouse software development team>). Advising clients about last mile implementations, online conversion and/or other business opportunities was part of my role. Day to day management of the teams was done by stand-up meetings, coaching and KPI management.

profile_positions.description:
KeenDelivery is an online logistics intermediary offering e-retailers (among others) an innovative solution that allows them to send and manage shipments through a single booking platform. This multi carrier platform can be directly linked to the e-retailer´s CMS (e.g. Magento, WooCommerce, Lightspeed, Amazon) or WMS to automatize the e-retailer’s logistics process. The company has contracts with a growing number of delivery operators (e.g. DHL, DPD, TNT, PostNL) allowing to offer a variety of worldwide logistics services through one portal. Making shipping easy for everyone, everywhere is the mission statement. So services are also offered to B2B companies and consumers (C2C and C2B). 

As Chief Financial Officer I was responsible for finance, HR, customer services and IT development. I ensured that these departments had the best working environment and processes, by individually managing and coaching the team leaders. I ensured financial targets and other KPI's were met.

This felt for me as an extra responsibility when one of our major automotive clients stopped their marketing activities in Europe. Besides my work as Chief Financial Officer I fire started from then successfully new business developments regarding online content creation and digital marketing for a significant number of multinationals and fashion brands (e.g. Volvo cars, de Bijenkorf, KPN, ABN AMRO, Scotch & Soda, McGregor).
profile_positions.title: Executive Boardmember / Co-Owner

profile_positions.description:
As Chief Financial Officer I was day-to-day responsible for the finance team, accurate management information, tax rulings <significant savings> and other related activities. I was also aligned in tenders, pitches, proposals and quotes in order to drive the business. During the years I coordinated the construction of 10,000 square meters new photo / film studio’s, office spaces and a helipad. Monthly (KPI’s), quarterly and annual reporting was done in Dutch GAAP. Contract management (e.g. Conditions of Purchase, Non Disclosure Agreements, Service Level Agreements), lease agreements, mortgages, insurance policies and others were also part of my responsibility. I was the architect of project number based financial workflows <activity-based costing>. Result: significant costs savings, better allocation of costs and huge improvement of insights. And I managed the implementation of new ERP software (ExactNext, Timewax). Result: one workflow for the total operation, from quotation to planning, invoicing and P&L analysis. Working with bankers, lawyers, accountants, and many others to keep the business running was my daily job.

During my years as Chief Financial Officer at Lukkien the profitability grew significantly.
